backgroundEvents.name: Final War of the Roman Republic
Eruption of Mt Vesuvius in AD 79

people.name: Gaius Marius
people.annotation: Novus homo - Seven times elected consul - First Man in Rome - Bloody tyrant

people.name: Julius Caesar
people.fate: Sic Semper Tyrannis, Ides of March 44 BC. Afterwards deified.

people.name: Sulla
people.fate: Resigned from power in 81 BC, died peacefully shortly thereafter.

people.name: Pompey Magnus
people.annotation: Triumvir, ally and rival of Caesar.
people.fate: Fled to Egypt after defeat by Caesar at Battle of Pharsalus and assassinated by Egyptian officials in 48 BC.

people.name: Augustus
people.annotation: Caesar's nephew and heir, the first Emperor of Rome.
people.fate: Died 19 August AD 14, aged 75, perhaps poisoned by Livia. Afterwards Deified.

people.name: Marcus Vipsanius Agrippa
people.annotation: Trusted and faithful friend, general and heir to Augustus, Agrippa was the grandfather and great-grandfather of emperors.
people.fate: Died peacefully but prematurely at age 51.

people.name: Tiberius
people.annotation: Stepson of Augustus, second emperor of Rome.
people.fate: Gradual withdrawal and decent into depravity until finally perishing AD 37.

people.name: Caligula
people.annotation: "... So much for Caligula as emperor; we must now tell of his career as a monster..." - Suetonius

people.name: Claudius
people.annotation: Uncle of Caligula, found hiding behind the curtains and declared emperor. Incorporated Britain.
people.fate: Murdered by wife and niece Agrippina to ensure the succession of her son Nero.

people.name: Nero
people.annotation: Artist, and last of the Julio-Claudians.
people.fate: Declared a public enemy by the Senate, fled Rome and ordered servant to kill him, precipitating the Year of the Four Emperors. "What an artist the world is losing!"

people.name: Valerian
people.fate: In AD 260, decisively defeated and captured alive by Sassanid King Sharpur I, for use as his footstool..

people.name: Macrianus Major
people.annotation: Usurper in the east with his sons.
people.fate: Defeated by Gallienus' general Aureolus in Thrace AD 261.

people.name: Macrianus Minor
people.annotation: Usurper in the east with his father and brother.
people.fate: Defeated by Gallienus' general Aureolus in Thrace AD 261.

people.name: Quietus
people.annotation: Usurper in the east with his father and brother.
people.fate: After his father Macrianus and brother were defeated by Gallienus, Odenathus beseiged Quietus at Emesa and killed by its inhabitants.

people.name: Postumus
people.annotation: Emperor of breakaway Gallic Empire. Defended Rhine frontier from Germanic invasions.

people.name: Aurelian
people.annotation: Restituto Orbis, the Restorer of the World.
people.fate: Mistakenly murdered by court officials, AD 275.

people.name: Diocletian
people.fate: Abdicated AD 305, forcing Maximian to do the same, and turned to the growing of cabbages.

conflicts.name: War with the early republic 505-4 BC
Shapur I#War against the Roman Empire
Shapur I#War against the Roman Empire
